reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Startup Sauna ? Project Hub Generation pilot

description.narrative: Facilitating entrepreneurship in emerging markets is an innovative way to bring people out of long- term poverty: new jobs generate income to provide self-sufficiency children?s education healthcare governmental income etc.The pilot has three main aims: to start help filling capacity deficiencies in the local partner?s ability to mentor their community startups by integrating some Startup Sauna methodologies and expertise, to research how the wider Finnish startup ecosystem could provide longer-term capacit y building support, and facilitate regional inter-hub and investor networking.The local partner iHub Nairobi is a nonprofit innovation tech hub connecting catalyzing and growing an entrepreneurial community. It is a forerunner in East Africa with some reno wned successes.The GSMA Entrepreneurship in Kenya 2014 report highlighted gaps in local expertise ? notably business acumen and marketing knowledge.Support will be delivered via 1-3 Startup Sauna coaches undertaking a combined total of 3 month residencies at iHub Nairobi. In partnership with iHub staff members the coach will provide support to iHub?s early-stage startup programs with a focus on mentoring business and/or communication skills.The initial stage of the project will be to package the Startup Sau na methodology into a manual that will function as a core reference throughout the pilot.A Startup Sauna Team networking week including a 2-3 day startup event will be co-hosted at at iHub Nairobi (also in Dar es Salaam and Addis Ababa). During these weeks the partnership will be expanded towards universities investors and other startup communities. The startup events give coaching feedback on business potential and pitching coaching from serial entrepreneurs investors and other industry experts ? from both the local country and Finland.The learnings gained during the pilot practical support and intelligence gathered during the residency research will be used to plan a 2-3 year program to trial a contextualized East African chapter of the Startup Sauna accel erator program in partnership with iHub Nairobi and also explore the steps required for an East African Slush event.
